description: Add Only. If true, will not allow update of an already existing Payment Term object.

Payment_TermsObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Payment_TermsObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Payment_TermsObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Payment_Terms_Data.description: The unique identifier for the Payment Terms

validation.validation: Enter a unique Payment Terms Name. [name] is already in use.
validation.description: The Payment Terms Name is already in use.

Payment_Terms_RuleObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Payment_Terms_RuleObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Payment_Terms_RuleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Payment_Term_Rule_Data.description: The order in which the rule is to be processed.

Payment_Terms_Rule_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Payment_Terms_Rule_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Payment_Terms_Rule_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Payment_Term_Rule_Data.description: The rule type.Can be 1 of the these:- Add Days- Add Month- Day of Month- End of Month

validation.validation: You can't select [previous_rule_type] before [current_rule_type] on the Due Date Rule order.
You can't select 2 consecutive [current_rule_type] rule types.

Payment_Term_Rule_Data.description: The numeric value to select for a specific rule type.

validation.validation: Enter a number other than zero for [current_rule_type].
Enter a number from 1 through [rule_modifier_max_value] for [current_rule_type].

Payment_Term_Rule_Data.description: Apply the cut-off condition to the specific rule type.

validation.validation: Clear Apply Cut-Off for the Day of Month Rule Type.
validation.description: Clear Apply Cut-Off for the Day of Month Rule Type.

validation.validation: Do not Apply Cut-Off without specifying a Cut-Off Day.
validation.description: Do not Apply Cut-Off without specifying a Cut-Off Day.

Payment_Terms_Data.description: The Element for the Payment Term Rule Data used in the Put/Get WWS

validation.validation: Select Apply Cutoff for at least 1 Due Date Rule Type when you've entered a number for Cut-Off Day.
validation.description: Select Apply Cutoff for at least 1 Due Date Rule Type when you've entered a number for Cut-Off Day.

validation.validation: You must have at least 1 Due Date Rule Type without Apply Cut Off.
validation.description: You must have at least 1 Due Date Rule Type without Apply Cut Off.

validation.validation: You can't apply a cut off to Add Months as it's a required Rule Type when you select Day of Month, except where Day of Month is greater than Cut-Off Day.
validation.description: You can't apply a cut off to Add Months as it's a required Rule Type when you select Day of Month, except where Day of Month is greater than Cut-Off Day.

Payment_Terms_Data.description: Day of the month to apply the cut-off.

validation.validation: Enter a number that isn't greater than 30 for Cut-Off Day.
